New York is a "one-party consent" state, which means that recording a conversation, in person or over the telephone, is legal as long as at least one of the parties involved in the conversation consents. So it would be illegal for me to record your conversation, but it is legal for you to record your conversation without the permission/knowledge of the other parties.
